thread.title: Greek banking system recapitalization to cost less than expected
thread.title_full: Greek banking system recapitalization to cost less than expected

author: NEOnline/GK
title: Greek banking system recapitalization to cost less than expected
text:
A review by the European Central Bank’s Single Supervisory Mechanism indicates that the Greek run for the banks this summer is going to cost little less than €20 bn. This summer’s recapitalization agreement has set aside € 25bn. That is good news for the Greek debt.
The ECB has declined to comment on this information published by the Greek media, citing an ECB source. The final ECB report is expected to be published on October 31 st .
Recapitalizing the four Greek systemic banks is necessary as their portfolio is deteriorating as a result of under-performing loans, tax hikes, and new austerity measures. Since the beginning of the crisis, under-performing loans are estimated to amount to 45% of total banking system assets, that is, a whopping € 100 bn, leading to successive bailout agreements.
